Runge–Kutta Embedded Methods of Orders 8(7) for Use in Quadruple Precision Computations

Important Note: This RK Pair is not very suitable for double-precision computations unless tolerances of up to
a minimum of 1e-9 are used. This is because many of the coefficients have large magnitudes, both positive and negative,
that result in catastrophic loss of digits and making the RK pair perform worse. Its full potential and better efficiency
other RK (7,8) pairs are only realized in quaruple precision computations.

Reference
-----------------------------
Kovalnogov, Vladislav & Fedorov, Ruslan & Karpukhina, Tamara & Simos, Theodore & Tsitouras, Charalampos. (2022). Runge–Kutta Embedded Methods of Orders 8(7) for Use in Quadruple Precision Computations. Mathematics. 10. 3247. 10.3390/math10183247.
